title: Visa Photo Requirements
content: Provide recent passport-sized photographs that meet U.S. visa photo specifications.

title: Visa Interview Tips
content: Practice answering common visa interview questions. Be confident, concise, and honest about your study plans and intentions to return to Nepal after completing your studies.

title: Visa Interview Scheduling
content: Schedule your F-1 visa interview at the U.S. Embassy in Kathmandu after paying the SEVIS fee and completing the DS-160. Be prepared for potential wait times.

title: Step-by-Step Guide to US Student Visa (F-1) for Nepali Students
content:
## Step-by-Step Guide to US Student Visa (F-1) for Nepali Students (2024)

This guide provides a comprehensive overview of the F-1 student visa application process for Nepali students. **Timeline (8-12 months before intended travel):**

1. **University Application (8-12 months before):** Research universities, prepare applications (including standardized tests like TOEFL, IELTS, GRE, GMAT), and apply. Note application deadlines vary. 2. **Receive I-20 (3-4 months before):** Upon acceptance, the university will issue Form I-20, Certificate of Eligibility for Nonimmigrant Student Status. 3. **Pay SEVIS Fee (3 months before):** Pay the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS) I-901 fee (currently $350) online at [https://www.fmjfee.com/i901fee/](https://www.fmjfee.com/i901fee/). Print the receipt. 4. **Complete DS-160 Form (3 months before):** Fill out the online nonimmigrant visa application (DS-160) at [https://ceac.state.gov/genniv/](https://ceac.state.gov/genniv/). Print the confirmation page. 5. **Schedule Visa Interview (3 months before):** Schedule an appointment at the US Embassy in Kathmandu via [https://www.ustraveldocs.com/np/](https://www.ustraveldocs.com/np/). Expect wait times, so book early. 6. **Pay Visa Application Fee (before interview):** Pay the non-refundable visa application fee (currently $160) through designated banks in Nepal. Details are available on the embassy website. 7. **Gather Supporting Documents:**
    * Passport valid for at least six months beyond intended stay. * DS-160 confirmation page. * SEVIS fee receipt. * I-20 form. * Financial documents proving ability to cover tuition and living expenses (bank statements, scholarship letters, sponsor affidavits). * Academic transcripts and certificates. * Standardized test scores. * Evidence of ties to Nepal (property ownership, family ties, employment letters). 8. **Attend Visa Interview:** Be prepared to answer questions about your academic plans, financial situation, and ties to Nepal. Dress professionally and be punctual. 9. **Biometrics (at interview):** Fingerprinting and photograph will be taken at the embassy during the interview. 10. **Medical Examination (if required):** The embassy may require a medical examination by a panel physician. 11. **Visa Issuance (if approved):** If your visa is approved, your passport with the visa stamp will be returned to you via courier or pick-up. 12. **Travel to the US:** You can enter the US up to 30 days before the start date on your I-20. **Tips:**
* Apply early. * Be honest and consistent in your answers. * Demonstrate strong ties to Nepal. * Prepare for questions related to your chosen field of study. **Emergency Contact:** US Embassy, Kathmandu: +977-1-423-4000

**Disclaimer:** This information is for guidance only. Always refer to the official US Embassy website for the latest information. - **Ward Verification Documents Required:**
  - Address verification certificate from local ward office
  - Name verification certificate
  - Income source verification
  - Birth certificate with ward office attestation
  - Family registration certificate
  - Property ownership verification (if applicable)

title: SEVIS Registration and I-20: A Guide for Nepali Students
content: This document explains the SEVIS registration process and how to obtain the I-20 form, crucial for Nepali students applying for F-1 or M-1 visas. After being accepted by a SEVP-certified U.S. institution, they will be registered in the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS). The institution will then issue Form I-20, "Certificate of Eligibility for Nonimmigrant Student Status," which students need to present during their visa interview. **Current SEVIS Fee (2024):** $350 USD (approx. NPR 46,200 at a hypothetical exchange rate of 132 NPR/USD). **I-20 details to verify:** Ensure your full name, date of birth, program of study, and start/end dates are accurate. Keep this document safe as you'll need it throughout your U.S. stay. **Nepal-specific note:**  While ward verification isn't directly tied to SEVIS,  ensure all your academic documents are attested by relevant Nepali authorities as needed by your chosen U.S. institution.

title: SEVIS Fee Payment
content: Pay the SEVIS I-901 fee (currently $350 USD) online before your visa interview. Keep the receipt; you'll need it.

title: Passport Validity
content: Ensure your passport is valid for at least six months beyond your intended period of stay in the U.S.

title: Mock Interview Practice
content: Consider practicing with mock visa interviews with education consultants or experienced individuals. This can improve your confidence and preparedness.

title: Maintaining Ties to Nepal
content: Emphasize your strong ties to Nepal to demonstrate your intent to return after completing your studies. This might include family ties, property ownership, or future career plans in Nepal.

title: I-20 Form
content: Your I-20 form, issued by your U.S. university, is crucial. Ensure it's accurate and signed. Carry it to your visa interview.

title: Financial Documentation
content: Prepare strong financial evidence demonstrating you can cover your tuition and living expenses in the U.S. This can include bank statements, fixed deposit certificates, and sponsorship letters. For Nepali applicants, it's beneficial to have ward verification of bank documents where possible.

title: DS-160 Form Guide:  A Step-by-Step Approach for Nepali Applicants
content: The DS-160, Online Nonimmigrant Visa Application, is a crucial step. This document provides a comprehensive guide for Nepali students. **Key details:**  Use English and avoid Nepali characters. Provide accurate information matching your passport. Upload a recent photograph meeting U.S. visa photo requirements. **Example:** For the 'Home Address' section, use your permanent Nepali address, even if currently residing elsewhere. For 'Purpose of Trip,' select 'Student (F-1)' or 'Student (M-1)'. **Nepal-specific information:**  The U.S. Embassy in Kathmandu processes applications from Nepal. The DS-160 confirmation page with barcode is mandatory for your visa interview. **Common mistakes to avoid:** Incorrectly spelling your name, providing conflicting information, or uploading an inappropriate photo.

title: DS-160 Form Completion
content: Complete the DS-160 form accurately and truthfully. Review every detail before submitting. Any errors can delay your visa process.

title: Be Prepared for Additional Documents
content: The consular officer might ask for additional documents. Be prepared to provide them promptly.

title: Academic Documents
content: Bring original and attested copies of your academic transcripts, certificates (SLC, +2, Bachelor's), and standardized test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, GRE, GMAT).

title: Scheduling the Visa Interview
content: After paying the MRV fee, schedule your visa interview appointment at the U.S. Embassy in Kathmandu through their online appointment system. Be prepared for potential wait times, and book your appointment as early as possible after receiving your I-20.

title: SEVIS Registration and I-20 Issuance
content: After receiving acceptance from a SEVP-certified U.S. institution like Harvard University (https://www.harvard.edu/international/), Nepali students must pay the SEVIS I-901 fee (currently $350 USD, approximately NPR 46,000 as of October 26, 2023). The university will then issue the I-20 form, which contains the SEVIS ID needed for visa application. Ensure all details on the I-20 are accurate, including your program of study and funding information.

title: Paying the Visa Application Fee (MRV Fee)
content: The MRV fee for F-1 student visas is currently $160 USD (approximately NPR 21,000 as of October 26, 2023). Payment options in Nepal may include bank transfers or online payments. Retain the payment receipt, as you'll need it to schedule your visa interview.

title: Completing the DS-160 Form: A Step-by-Step Guide for Nepali Students
content: The DS-160 is a crucial online form for U.S. visa applicants. Access it via the U.S. Embassy Nepal website. Provide accurate information, including your Nepali citizenship, passport details, educational background, and intended U.S. address. Upload a recent photograph meeting U.S. visa photo requirements. Upon submission, you'll receive a confirmation page with a barcode, crucial for scheduling your visa interview.
